## Reason of admission
69 years old man who came in on the 2024-01-08 with a swollen right lower extremity since three days. Patient noticed progress of swelling and appearance of erythema and diffucluty walking on day 3. Body temperature 39 degrees Celsius. 

## Medical history
High bloodpressure, diabetes mellitus type 2, chronic kidney disease stage 3

## Hospital course
On examination swollen right leg with defined redness and tenderness when palpated. CRP 279. Leukocytes 16,2. Creatinine 137. Blood cultures have been obtained and patient received Bensylpenicillin 1 gram x 3 intravenously for suspected erysipelas. To exclude the presence of deep vein thrombosis in the right leg the patient underwent an ultrasound examination which did not reveal any signs of a deep vein thrombosis. Patient recieved oxynorm and was able to mobilise the leg. No fever. No pain. CRP 147, leukocytes normalized, P-crea 128. Ward nurse informed patients wife and planned for transporatation home on 2024-01-11. Bensylpenicillin i.v. changed to fenoximetylpenicillin 1gx3 until 19/1.
